article.headline: Old Dominion 69, Northeastern 59
article.story: BOSTON -- Kent Bazemore scored 21 points and Old Dominion defeated Northeastern 69-59 on Saturday in the Colonial Athletic Association opener for both teams. With Northeastern leading 40-38 early in the second half, Old Dominion made a 12-0 run to lead 50-40 with 10:36 to play after two free throws by Nick Wright, who was 8 of 9 from the line. Northeastern could get no closer than five points the rest of the way and the lead remained in double digits for the final 3:39. Chris Cooper added 17 points and Wright had 13 for the Monarchs (5-3), who own the first two-game winning streak in the 10- game history of the series. Quincy Ford scored 16 points and Jonathan Lee added 11 for the Huskies (3-3). Northeastern, which entered the game leading the conference in rebounding average and rebounding margin, was outrebounded 35-30. Old Dominion outscored Northeastern 16-11 on second-chance points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
